title: How to automatically save bookmarks on shut down to a location other than your profile.
content:
I think the about:config setting "browser.bookmarks.autoExportHTML" "True" will cause the saving of bookmark.html to the current profile when FireFox shuts down. I found that in a Help response.

Included in the response was a method of saving bookmark.html to a different location.

I cannot find the that help response and would like to implement a save in another location.

title: Firefox won't start after fresh re-install
content:
Problem = "Firefox is already running but is not responding" error. Firefox does not open a browser window. I uninstalled firefox, deleted the necessary files in the registry and deleted / backed-up all my profiles.

Still doesn't open. I cannot terminate the firefox.exe in the taskmanager. I also tried to open firefox in safe mode.

my profile.ini looks like this after the reinstall :

[Install308046B0AF4A39CB] Default=Profiles/br44he6u.default-release Locked=1

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/saqp6yc1.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/br44he6u.default-release

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

My installs.ini :

[308046B0AF4A39CB] Default=Profiles/br44he6u.default-release Locked=1


Registry files deleted before reinstall :

HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\FirefoxHTML; HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Mozilla; HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\MozillaPlugins; HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Mozilla; HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\MozillaPlugins.

title: Why do my animated themes stop animating and can only be re-activated with a system restore on my PC
content:
Around 10th July 2019 my animated themes stopped working when I opened my browser. The image was there but it was not animating This was possibly after a Firefox update but I am not sure. When the themes were not animating the appearance of the theme page differed from when the themes were working.

Attachment 1 shows the theme page when the theme is enabled and working. Attachment 2 shows the theme page appearance when it is not working. Clicking on the 3 dots on the bottom right (when they are not working) takes you into the settings for the theme but there is no way of re-activating the animation.

I have found the only way of re-activating the animation in all of the animated themes I have is to do a system restore back to 10th July 2019. This is not practical to do every time I close down my computer and re-open it to find my animated theme not working.

If I do a system restore and get the animated themes working and log out of Firefox the themes will not be working when I log in again in the same working session on my PC.

Any help would be appreciated,

title: change color for specific bookmark folder by right-clicking?
content:
I LOVE Firefox. The only thing that I'm really missing is the ability to right click on a bookmark folder (or bookmark item) and change the color.

This way I could quickly tell which were more important and needed attention.

I have so many bookmarks and folders, at times it's very hard to find what I'm looking for.

One other small suggestion: In 'Search bookmarks', I can find bookmarks by topic. But, if I'm trying to find a bookmark I've 'lost', it won't show me where it's located in the bookmark folder hierarchy. Possibly a right click to 'open containing bookmark folder would be useful to others also if this positioned the bookmarks toolbar folder tree to show the location of the bookmark from the search?

title: New update does not work well with Amazon labels
content:
I am so tired of the constant FF updates. Not only do I have to rearrange my toolbars to the way they were before, when I go to print a label from Amazon Seller Central (pdf) it is nowhere to be seen. I went to IE to print it. Then I went into Options and figured out how to get my PDF files to a place I could use them.

Really, FF, if the default after an update is "your downloaded PDF files disappear and we don't know where they are" that's not a good thing. I am wondering why I still use FF. It used to be a good browser but lately I wonder. I have unchecked the "automatic updates" box after quite some time of allowing them.

title: Ant Video Downloader
content:
Hace años que uso Firefox como navegador principal porque tenía una extensión execpcional, el Ant Video Downloader, que también usan otros navegadores aunque en ninguno funcionaba tan bien como en Firefox. En realidad esta addon sigue funcionando y hace correctamente su función básica, que es descargar archivos.

Sin embargo lo que convertía esta app en una joya era que en sus versiones anteriores tenía integrado un reproductor Flash Player, y de hecho se sigue anunciando como si siguiera teniendo el reproductor cuando no es así:

https://addons.mozilla.org/es/firefox/addon/video-downloader-player/

La ventaja de que llevase integrado este reproductor es que te permitía ordenar limpiamente tus archivos y ponerlos en orden de una manera distinta a la habitual y muy eficaz.

Puesto en contacto con los desarrolladores de esta app parece que el problema está en que la app no es compatible con las actualizaciones de Firefox. En definitiva que me veo obligado a cambiar de navegador y mantener una versión antigua del Firefox para poder usar el Ant Video Downloader como a mí me gusta. No como me obliga Firefox a usarlo.

¿Aquí no hay nadie capaz de hacer que Ant Video Downloader vuelva a instalarse con el reproductor integrado que lo hacía distinto a todas las apps de descarga de vídeos?

title: My javascript stopped working today when viewing my C Drive content, but still OK once at website
content: I use javascript:change_frames extensively on my websites to map a thumbnail to 2 or 3 different iframes and it has always worked in all browsers ios, android - everything. But just now it will not work in Firefox as I try to test my pages prior to FTP to my hosting, although it DOES work once on the www. It this caused by some new version and can I revert to a version that does not zap my javascript? Thanks in advance as this is driving me crazy (and to Chrome or Edge after 24 years using Mozilla stuff)
